--- layout: default title: OHBM 2016 ---
This collection organizes a number of different posters and talks from NISOx and NISOx collaborators at the 2016 Organization for Human Brain Mapping (OHBM) in Geneva, 26-30 June.

Talks

This section lists all available OHBM 2016 standalone talks by NISOx and NISOx collaborators.
  • Practical Intensity-Based Meta-Analysis
    Author: Camille Maumet. Neuroimaging Meta-Analysis Educational Course. doi:10.6084/m9.figshare.5473165.v1

Posters

This section lists all available posters submitted to OHBM 2016 by NISOx and NISOx collaborators. Boldface lettering indicates the day of presentation.
  • 1605-Tu Cluster failure: Why fMRI inferences for spatial extent have inflated false positive rate
    Authors: Thomas Nichols, et al.
  • 1851-Tu NIDM-Results: Standardized reporting of mass univariate neuroimaging results in SPM, FSL and AFNI
    Authors: Camille Maumet, et al.
  • 2075-Tu Confidence Sets - Going Beyond Voxel-level and Cluster-level Null Hypothesis testing
    Authors: Alex Bowring, et al.
  • 2216-M Faster permutation inference in neuroimaging
    Authors: Anderson M. Winkler, et al.
  • 2221-W Neuropower: a toolbox for fMRI sample size and power calculations
    Authors: Joke Durnez, et al.
  • 3450-W Heritability of Global Architectural Features of the Functional Connectome of the Human Brain
    Authors: Soroosh Afyouni, et al.
  • 3462-W Nonparametric Inference for Neuroimaging Genetics Analysis(NINGA): Fast & powerful regression and heritability for related subjects
    Authors: Habib Ganjgahi, et al.
  • 3463-Th Faster Accelerated Permutation Inference for the ACE Model (APACE) with Parallelization
    Authors: Xu Chen, et al.
  • 3771-Th A Bayesian Marked Hierarchical Spatial Point Process Model with Covariates for Lesion Data
    Authors: Bernd Taschler, et al.
  • 3885-Th Scaling up Directed Graph Models for Resting-State fMRIwith Stepwise Regression
    Authors: Ruth Harbord, et al.
  • 3973-Th Understanding Rich Club with a Stochastic Block Model
    Authors: Soroosh Afyouni, et al.
